definition: line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.chinese: 他們只是方框和線條圖。

sentences.english: Arced lines are frequently used in Chinese-style design.

sentences.english: The firelight danced over her face, over the steep lines of her cheekbones.

sentences.english: The main sound box uses the edges and corners distinct rectangle design, the line succinct sprightly .

sentences.english: I used fabric leftover from curtains I made in my daughter’s room (I’ll have a post on that another day) for the lining.

sentences.english: The eye tends to follow these lines to the point where they converge.
